intro: Adenosma thwaitesii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved adenosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Adenosma thwaitesii is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
